---

I had an epiphany while looking at the cleric class. It astounds me that I can still find hidden things in Dungeon World after all this time. So, I present my character concept, using the cleric to create a fictionally similar, yet different class.<br /><br />The Monk<br /><br />(I would advise speaking with your DM to make sure using your fists can still deal your class damage, at least with magic weapon cast on them. Otherwise, I would use the staff or another monk-like weapon.)<br /><br />Race: Human (Chosen spell: Magic Missile)<br /><br />Alignment: Lawful<br /><br />Stats: Focus on WIS and DEX with the third best stat in CON. <br /><br />Deity Domain: Whatever suits you (I will choose The Downtrodden and Forgotten)<br /><br />Precept: Suffering<br /><br />Divine Guidance<br /><br />Turn Undead: Prayer Beads<br /><br />Commune<br /><br />Cast a Spell (Key Spells: Magic Weapon, Bless, Magic Missile [Ki Blast], Healing Spells, Harm, possibly Hold Person)<br /><br />Starting Gear: Dungeon Rations, Symbol of the divine (Prayer Beads), Chainmail (can wear until you get divine protection or disregard it entirely), Staff and bandages, Healing potion.<br /><br />Advanced Moves (2-5)<br /><br />2: Divine Protection (classic monk ability)<br />3: Serenity (to keep magic weapon or bless up)<br />4: Divine Intervention for those matrix style dodges (or Empower for better Magic Missile damage or better healing)<br />5: Penitent (goes with my deity&#39;s precept)<br /><br />Advanced Moves (6-10)<br /><br />6: Martyr (for those powerful Magic Missile counter attacks or a big heal)<br />7: Divine Invincibility (or Greater Empower)<br />8: Providence (to keep magic weapon and bless up)<br />9: Apotheosis (for flavor, or choose something else like Chosen One for Magic Missile as a Rote)<br />10: Divine Armor or Multiclass Dabbler for a monkish move from another class.  <br /><br />Obviously there is a lot of room for customization depending on the type of monk you want to play. I just thought it was a cool &quot;what here is not what it appears to be&quot; type of thing. What do you all think?
